modules.description: This module provides access to various POSIX clock implementations, allowing precise time measurements for different system and thread-specific contexts. It supports operations to retrieve clock values representing real time, monotonic time, CPU execution time, and other platform-specific durations. Concrete use cases include measuring process execution time, tracking system uptime, and obtaining high-resolution timestamps for performance monitoring or event scheduling.

This module provides direct access to POSIX clock operations, enabling retrieval of time values for various system clocks, including real-time, monotonic, and CPU-specific clocks. It supports precise time measurement, clock setting, and sleep operations with nanosecond resolution, working with `Timespec.t` structures. Concrete use cases include measuring execution durations, implementing high-precision delays, and synchronizing events based on system or thread-specific time sources.
